website_summaries.verdict: More than just a toy, this keyboard gives kids a realistic experience, with touch-sensitive keys and a surprisingly realistic tone.
pros: Boasts 61 full-size keys and 400 instrument voices
Programmed with more than 100 preset songs
Touch-sensitive keys adjust volume with pressure
Headphone jack and auxiliary jack included
cons: power adapter must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE YOU BUY
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this keyboard is by far one of the nicest for the money and that is why I'm leaving 5 stars! With that being said, it DOES NOT COME WITH A POWER CORD! The listing doesnt say it does but I assumed it did and then had to buy one after we got it and realized if we didnt want it to run on batteries that we needed one! So do yourself a favor and buy a cord with this keyboard!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: to beginners buying this:
customer_reviews.text: while this is a good first piano, be aware that there is no difference between light and hard touch, no sustain, the keys are loud and have a plastic sound, and it is smaller than an average piano. however, for an absolute beginner like me, it works amazing, has many sounds and features, and gets the basics across. it just will not be very similar in feel to a real piano.
customer_reviews.author: Usman

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple keyboard for my audio setup and the Yamaha is perfect. I am running it through my Korg Kaoss Pad, Pioneer RMX 500 and the Boss RC-505 Loop Station. These are plugged into the auxiliary channel in my Pioneer DJ deck for studio playback. The keyboard delivers great sounds from the onboard voice bank and with the setup I am using, I am able to create unreal synthesizer effects. It works great for recording and I am looking at setting it up with a talk box for cool voice effecting.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tone, helpful when i need to move around with a keyboard, the larger one was heavy and i worried i would drop it. This helps me to practice when my grands are running around i don't worry about accidents. The Yamaha brand is my fav. I know i will have a quality instrument.
customer_reviews.author: PViola

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality
customer_reviews.text: I returned two other cheaper keyboards because I did not care for the sound. This keyboard has great sound with a lot of features I probably will never use. There are other keyboards out there for professionals but this one is perfect for learning to play the piano/keyboard. I believe it is more than adequate for the beginner and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M. Papallo

customer_reviews.title: No power cord???  Nickel and diming!
customer_reviews.text: Imagine my surprise when I opened up the box and found there was no power cord! I see, when I look back at the description, that I neglected to notice this NECESSARY piece of equipment is not included. Now, I can understand optional items not being included in the package. But to not include something that is essential to the basic operation of the instrument? That's cheap!!! It's an instance, I say, of nickeling and diming the customer. What's next? Pretty soon they'll be sending out pianos that only have white keys. There will be spaces and mechanisms for the black keys, but you'll have to pay extra for the plastic tops, then snap them into place yourself.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I'll need a new one for a while❤️
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't say it's a very durable piano but pianos aren't meant to be treated like a toy anyhow. They are not weighted keys. I got the 61 keyboard. Multiple sounds but nothing to crazy. Haven't figured out how to split the keyboard yet. Lightweight. Some people reported theirs being arrived broken but mine arrived in one peace and was not hard to get started at all. My children and I love it and we're happy we bought it. It was an expensive compared to most Yamaha pianos I really do prefer Yamaha instruments or Casio. I would not go with a knockoff brand if you actually are serious about learning how to play or teaching someone to play.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Great piano for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this piano primarily for the voice lessons I teach every week, as well as my own music writing purposes (primarily chords and trying new melodies). I love it! It's definitely small, but the different sound settings on the piano are awesome for songwriting, and it works well for what I want it for, simple piano playing - scales, chords, and playing warmups for my voice students. If you're looking to practice to be a professional pianist, you may want to look into the more expensive keyboards with more range & abilities, but if you're using it for more minimalistic/fun purposes, it's great, and at a great rice!
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: The songs are great! Many choices and I love that. I am 62 and bought this to be able to practice the songs we are singing in our church choir. The most awesome thing , aside from the whole keyboard sound and size, is that it is so light weight!! Being able to move this as needed without needing a team of men to help me move it - is AWESOME! This is a great purchase for me and the needs I have. This purchase was better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Glosenger

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard for the money. If you need something for practice purposes, this keyboard is a great buy. I also received a free 3 month subscription to the skoove piano app which was a nice bonus. I've been taking myself through it and it's helping with improving my skills. The package deal with the bench and stand you can't beat! Yamaha is always consistent with quality!
customer_reviews.author: GAP

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner through advanced.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for eight year-old granddaughter who has no formal piano training but is nicely musically inclined. The piano sound is great, keys are responsive and sturdy and the wide array of available instrument sounds and other, um, noises is impressive. Works wonderfully as an introduction to music for a child and as a nice, high quality, versatile keyboard for a more experienced musician. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: No power included...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't quite get what I thought I paid for. I suppose it will last a few months if my kids are careful with it. NO power supply is included. Takes 12v supply sold separately or 6 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: K. Slemmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but adapter not included.
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard for the money. The product also arrived 2 days before expected. It's very lightweight and the sound quality is excellent. If you're looking for a beginner keyboard for adults, this is it. So many sound functions and pre-sets. I gave it 5 stars because I'm was so impressed by it for the price. Only flaw to me was that it didn't come with an electical adapter. Lucky for me, I had one that would work. If you don't have a 12v adapter then you'll need to order one or just get 6 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: David Patterson

customer_reviews.title: NO POWER CORD
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU WANT TO SPEND ANOTHER $10 FOR A POWER CORD. I wass not too happy that my son had to use up all of my batteries because the power cord was not included. I should of read the reviews before buying it for my son.
customer_reviews.author: SMAN

customer_reviews.title: Really nice sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter so she could practice her piano lessons at home. At first I'd purchased a $50.00 piano who's sound was very tinny, and there was a broken key. So then I almost doubled the price and got the Yamaha. What a difference in sound and quality! My granddaughter is happy and so am I!
customer_reviews.author: Julie V

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha sound processing is the best.
customer_reviews.text: The Yamaha PSR synthesizer organ keyboard is good. Do not mistake it for a digital piano. Keyboard has spring-loaded organ keys, not piano keys. The Yamaha quality sound processing is as good as any in its price range. Yamaha started out as a piano manufacturer. That's why their logo is an image of three tuning forks in the shape of a Y.
customer_reviews.author: Will Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, no power adapter included
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it. We were a little upset that there was no power adapter included.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: awesome beginner keyboard
customer_reviews.text: we gave this to our daughter for christmas and she has been glued to it ever since, she is teaching her self how to play and is coming along quickly, she really loves this keyboard, the only thing she can say negative about it, is 'why didnt she get it sooner' :)
customer_reviews.author: Hindean

customer_reviews.title: Nice piano
customer_reviews.text: I looked for pianos for a while before I chose this one. I am an adult beginner to piano and I’m really enjoying it. I did have to buy a power cord and I want to buy a stand eventually. Just be prepared to buy those additional things as they don’t come with it. But the piano itself is great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Even Turn On, Among Other Things
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard came in in the worst looking box I have ever seen. Not only did it come without an AC adapter cord, it doesn’t turn on. Period. Just doesn’t work whatsoever. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna SG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a better manual! Please include ac adapter
customer_reviews.text: A wide array of sounds. Great for beginners and I think my son will still like it after. A better user manual would be nice, and adding an ac adapter would be great
customer_reviews.author: Mom of a Dozen

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners piano
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner piano, to enable the sustain pedal, you have to go into the functions options and look around for the sustain pedal "On". Definitely read the manual and search around online to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve JS

customer_reviews.title: bad Policy
customer_reviews.text: When you spend this much money buying a keyboard you would expect that it would come with a manual on how to use all the functions but that is not the case so be prepared to go on line and print it out yourself
customer_reviews.author: Terri Graham

customer_reviews.title: Inspiration for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids immediately took to the piano. The teaching app had them playing a melody the first lesson. The youngest enjoyed exploring sounds as she’s not ready to read music. This is a great introduction to music.
customer_reviews.author: Alma L. Annab

customer_reviews.title: Early death
customer_reviews.text: I have this to my son for his birthday in May. He loved it! Then, three months later it stopped working. Turns on for a moment, then turns off. I've swapped batteries, tried a power adapter... Nothing. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahjane

customer_reviews.title: BEST sound!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality! We use an app to learn how to play the keyboard and the app has no issues with sound quality u like the previous keyboard we purchased and returned! If you want the best sound quality, Yamaha is the way to gig!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Bradbury

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT come with adapter
customer_reviews.text: It only cost me only $10 to buy an adapter but it was the extra time wasted. It's so inexpensive for the manufacturer to include a AC adapter.. I don't know why it does not come with one. I have to wait an extra 2-3 days before I can use the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M Breen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I play for fun. It’s light. Piano sounds great. No issues. I’m trying to learn bohemian rhapsody and there aren’t enough keys, so if you want to learn big songs you just need to get more keys. But Yamaha is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jluu

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and good quality
customer_reviews.text: We are still exploring the keyboard. But so far it brings so much fun and learning time for my kid. It can be used as speakers and play party music from phone, used to teach kid piano and other musical instrument sounds, knowledge. And the fun to make music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboArd.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat a Yamaha. Bought it for my granddaughter and is ideal for a beginner. Get additional online or one to one lessons. Y.E.S is not great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer -Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This proudct is a great value for the money! Decent speakers, lot's of voices and modes, and very portable! And though it is nice, I will say it is %100 a beginner product.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as a beginner piano but the speaker is sensitive to volume distortion at high volumes after a few playing sessions when batteries start to drain.
customer_reviews.author: TheMrIggs

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard, sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this used. Beautiful keyboard. Sounds great. Many features. Playing Linkin Park on it. 64 or 68 keys on it. Standard size keyboard. Uses 8 AAA batteries I think or an AC plug. 5/5 stars. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kiehn

customer_reviews.title: AC adapter missing from box -
customer_reviews.text: I received the keyboard. It seems fine - but the battery cover seems a bit bent, also the AC adapter is not included and it was supposed to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam H.

customer_reviews.title: good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a good keyboard for beginners. Yamaha booklet has all the instructions and uses for all the buttons so need to read it first so that you wont be overwhelmed by it. Good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: F.G.

customer_reviews.title: portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: bought for my grand kids. Maybe a bit to difficult for them but they love banging on the keys and changing the sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I play the piano for my own enjoyment and this Yamaha keyboard was a winner! The sounds and rhythms are great. Yamaha is more expensive but we’ll worth it. I’ve had other keyboards but none compare to the quality and technology offer by Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Tedesco

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for beginners and provides all the features you need to get started. It seemed to be a bit big initially but I got used to it and love playing/learning when I get a chance. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ajat K

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard. I'm sure it works great, if you're actually playing it.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a film prop. Not sure how it actually works, as they model played it with her feet. It sure looks good though!
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, wonderful sound
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is phenomenal for the money and a super way to spend time during pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Roxx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old daughter loves hers. She wanted one for 2 years I finally bought & she’s on it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got it without a cord to plug it in had to try to find one. Ended up having to return it and when i did i didn’t get my money back i got an Amazon gift card..
customer_reviews.author: Debra perez

customer_reviews.title: No adapter
customer_reviews.text: It is ridiculous that it doesn’t come together with adapter or batteries. No remind when buying. I wait a week for this and have no adapter. Ridiculous.

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste money on cheap toys
customer_reviews.text: We got a little toy piano and it just did not give the child the sense of a real instrument. This is what you want if you are trying to foster interest in learning music

customer_reviews.title: My sister loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my lovely sister for her birthday. She always wanted to learn how to use the piano. This was a perfect beginner option. It came perfectly fine and exactly like the picture. Thank you!

customer_reviews.title: Great piano for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a piano for vocal lessons and this works great.

customer_reviews.title: Aux doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The aux does’t work - ordered it twice and both didn’t connect to headphones or speaker

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: Really love it. Larger than you'd expect. Now if my dog would allow mw to play it, that would be pretty awesome.

customer_reviews.title: Buy adapter first
customer_reviews.text: No adapter, no offer to add a adapter, super annoying I have to wait even longer than it already took to even see if it works smh...... Thanks for the very unnoticeable heads up.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 year old son. He grew weary of the violin, and needed something to finish out his virtual school year. This is an awesome instrument for a beginner, or even intermediate to write songs. Great sound!

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Adult Beginner
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for adult beginners. It has enough bells and whistles to make learning fun. I don't feel overwhelmed. It fit my personal needs. Very pleased overall.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good, for someone who doesn’t know much about them, it looks and sounds great. Plus it has a wall adapter so don’t have to worry about batteries.

customer_reviews.title: Good !But no power adapter ,just a keyboard!

product_meta.title: YAMAHA PSR-E263 61-Key Portable Keyboard
product_meta.description:
The Yamaha PSR-E263 is a 61-key portable keyboard featuring a wide variety of sounds and functions. With the included 3-step lesson program, It is ideal first keyboard for aspiring musicians who are just starting out. Use the on-board lesson feature, Yamaha Education Suite (Y. E. S. ) to learn the 100 preset songs, or take advantage of 385 instrument voices and 100 styles to experiment and create your own music. The aux line input turns the PSR-E263 into a speaker system for your MP3 player so you can play along or just listen, all for a very affordable price.

Tuning: 427.0 - 440.0 - 453.0 Hz (approx.0.2Hz increments).
feature_bullets: The PSRE263 Yamaha portable keyboard features a wide variety of sounds and functions for beginners
61 full sized keys are great for learning and developing keyboard playing technique
The Yamaha Education Suite can be used with the more than 100 preset songs, making it the ideal first keyboard for aspiring musicians
The aux line input allows you to connect any music device with a headphone output, such as an MP3 player, a computer, a mixer or even another instrument, and hear it through the internal speakers
Power adapter sold separately; Tone generating technology: AWM stereo sampling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars790 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
